text:
Republicans wasted so much time and taxpayer money on an impeachment investigation that found nothing. This is dead.
 
It's long past time for Speaker Johnson and the House GOP to move on and start actually working to solve problems for the American people.

AI is a powerful tool that can recognize links and patterns in data, and its application in medicine has enormous potential to help us improve early detection, understand complex diseases, and even identify better treatment options.

Republicans created shutdown cliffs by trying to break their fiscal deal with the President over and over again, but the House just finally passed a major appropriations bill, halfway through FY24. Democrats provided the votes - from the minority - to prevent a shutdown, again.
CNN: As US Congress stalls on aid, Ukrainian soldiers head to the frontlines knowing they don’t have enough ammunition

For the fourth time in FY24 the House was forced to vote on a last-minute stopgap to avert a shutdown because Republicans wanted to break the deal they made with the President last year. All four times Democrats kept the lights on as much of the GOP majority voted for a shutdown.

This endless bloodshed has to stop, and humanitarian aid must be allowed to reach those who need it.

We need a ceasefire.
When Democrats passed the Women’s Health Protection Act to protect reproductive freedoms last congressional session, EVERY single Republican voted against it.

“Democratic lawmakers passed two key climate laws a little more than two years ago, with virtually no Republican votes. Since then, companies have announced $170 billion in new or expanded factories and mining projects in the U.S. that would add around 200,000 new industrial jobs.”
For the third time in less than six months, Republican infighting instigates fear and uncertainty for American families: "Military families are sick of feeling like political pawns."
“The congressional proposal, known as the Life at Conception Act… has no provisions for processes like IVF, meaning access to the procedure would not be protected.”

“On Wednesday, researchers from Princeton University and the Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory reported in the journal Nature they found a way to use AI to forecast these potential instabilities and prevent them from happening in real time.”

This isn't science. It isn't health care. It's extremism.

Trump and MAGA Republicans killed Roe v Wade protections and now they're carrying the war on reproductive freedoms even further, with devastating results for American families.
Urgent passage of Ukraine aid in Congress is vital to counter Russia’s illegal invasion and uphold American national security. We must get it done.

AI holds immense potential for advancements in tech, medicine, and other areas. Our newly formed AI Taskforce seeks to harness these benefits responsibly by crafting guiding principles and policies that address potential risks, while ensuring American innovation and leadership.

Alexei Navalny's death is intended to silence internal Russian dissent and hope for freedom and democracy. This is a chilling reminder of Vladimir Putin’s tyranny and the necessity of protecting a free Ukraine.

The House must pass Ukraine aid to counter Putin's aggression.

While there is no substitute to an end to the fighting, I’m glad to see President Biden granting DED for Palestinians at risk of deportation. We must do more to protect innocent life amid this awful conflict.

American support for Ukraine has been crucial as they fight against invading Russian armies. As Republicans continue to block additional funding for Ukraine’s defense, Putin and his allies in the Kremlin celebrate.
A great morning with Washington Post Live, Cat Zakrzewski and Rep. Marc Molinaro discussing AI, its impacts, and the legislation we’re working on in Congress to ensure the safe use of AI.

Our bill would help all children entering adulthood have the means to invest in their future and create economy-wide benefits by ensuring more Americans have economic access to pursue an education, start businesses, and buy homes.

“House Republicans are ducking difficult policy work and hard-fought compromise. Impeachment is a diversion from fixing our broken immigration laws and giving DHS the resources needed to secure the border.”

15 years ago today President Obama signed his first bill into law: the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act, a big step forward in the struggle for equal pay. That work continues, and reducing the gender pay gap is a major focus for me as we seek passage of the Paycheck Fairness Act.

Since Joe Biden became president, the unemployment rate in America has remained under 4% for 23 months in a row.

The longest stretch in 50 years.

Prime Minister Netanyahu's position as stated here is antithetical to American interests, the long term security of Israel, the wellbeing of Palestinians, and hopes for peace in the region. I urge the Administration to forcefully reject this.
Read my latest ‘On Fusion Energy’: “If we can achieve commercial fusion energy now, we would leave future generations with an immeasurable gift.”

Thanks to critical funding passed by Democrats, the IRS has recovered over half a billion dollars in overdue taxes from wealthy taxpayers.
 
Republicans are fighting to gut this funding.

This is appalling, and frankly shameful: “Republican governors in 15 states are rejecting a new federally funded program to give food assistance to hungry children during the summer months, denying benefits to 8 million children across the country.”

ICYMI: I was proud to help secure paid family and medical leave for veterans in the federal government workforce as part of legislation signed into law by President Biden. The legislation also included a 5.2% pay raise for military servicemembers!
Rare honesty from former President Donald Trump to say he doesn't care if American families suffer as long as he benefits politically, a view many of his fellow Republicans clearly share.

Every child deserves to go to school in a safe bus and breathe clean air – that’s why I helped secure funding to bring an electric school bus to the City of Falls Church in 2022.

Glad to see the EPA getting out more Bipartisan Infrastructure Law funding to purchase these buses nationwide!
This is huge news as we continue to shift toward clean energy: Two offshore wind sites are sending power to the US grid for the very first time!
“Not only was there no recession in 2023, but growth accelerated as the year progressed. Inflation cooled sharply (from 6.4 percent to 3.1 percent), and the economy added more than 2.5 million jobs.”

This decision is absolutely horrific and severely endangers the health and lives of women in Texas.

Abortion should be a medical decision between a woman and her doctor – not the court.

“Rep. Don Beyer (D-Va.) and Rep. Anna Eshoo (D-Calif) will introduce a bill in the House of Representatives on Friday that would require companies creating artificial intelligence models to disclose details about how they develop that technology.”

The House GOP majority made Congress far less effective by empowering the extreme right and refusing to solve problems. This is why they can't, as one Republican put it, name "one material, meaningful, significant thing the Republican majority has done."

Read more: www.axios.com/2023/12/19/1...
Under Republican leadership, the House has been in complete chaos. By stark contrast, the House had an incredibly productive 2022 – delivering real results for the American people.

The gun lobby has long claimed, falsely, that commonsense reforms to prevent gun violence like bans on assault weapons and high capacity magazines are "unconstitutional."

The most conservative Supreme Court in nearly a century just disagreed with no noted dissents.

On December 14, 2012, 20 children and 6 educators were killed at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown.
 
11 years later, guns are the leading cause of death for American children. We must do so much more to address the toll gun violence continues to take. America’s children deserve better.
This measure to help veterans in the federal workforce qualify for family and medical leave was included in legislation that just passed the House which now goes to the President for signature!
Associated Press: Wholesale inflation in US slowed further last month, signaling that price pressures continue to ease

More than half of all abortions in the U.S. are performed via medication. It is safe, effective, and less invasive than surgical procedures.
 
I urge the court to follow the science and protect patient’s access to mifepristone. Women deserve safe, accessible health care.
CBS: Inflation eased in November as gas prices fell

The Texas Supreme Court reversed a lower court’s ruling that would’ve allowed a woman to obtain a legal abortion under a medical emergency exception. This is extremely dangerous.

Abortion is health care – and women should not be forced to travel out of state to receive essential health care.

I worked with Shopify to convene a group of community small business owners to discuss a wide range of policy issues impacting their ability to run and grow their companies. 

I’ll keep working to ensure Congress helps, not harms local small businesses.
Wishing a happy first night of Hanukkah to all celebrating tonight. May peace, joy, and light be with you this holiday season. Chag Sameach!

FULL STEAM AHEAD: We are thrilled to announce a $𝟳𝟮𝟵 𝗠𝗜𝗟𝗟𝗜𝗢𝗡 investment in Virginia rail projects including the Long Bridge Project thanks to the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act! This is a huge deal for Virginia infrastructure!!!
“Don Beyer isn’t the average student at George Mason University. He’s 73 years old. He prefers a notebook and pen to a laptop for note-taking. And he’s a top lawmaker on AI policy in Congress.”

Monitoring the emergency response to a major explosion in the Bluemont neighborhood of Arlington tonight. This is very, very scary, and my profound thanks go out to first responders working to secure the area and keep everyone safe.

Last year, Congress passed the most important gun violence prevention law in 28 years. It’s making a difference: “The Bipartisan Safer Communities Act has also led to the seizure of over 1,300 guns, including 190 AR-style rifles that are frequently a weapon of choice in mass shooting attacks…”
Bloomberg: US Economy Grew 5.2% in Third Quarter, More Than First Estimated

The Biden Administration remains committed to lowering costs, and its newly announced actions to expand the capacity and resiliency of our supply chains and speed up the movement of goods will do just that.

Smoother operations mean lower prices and more cash in American pockets.

Physical barriers and nets on bridges, like the netting nearly completed on Golden Gate Bridge, help prevent suicide and save lives.

My bipartisan Barriers to Suicide Act would help many more states and localities fund these types of barriers with grants.

I support the negotiations seeking a deal on a ceasefire in exchange for the release of hostages and the delivery of humanitarian assistance. 

My full statement:

Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, we’ve been able to support more than 40,000 projects across the country. That means better roads, better bridges, better transit, better airports, better jobs.
 
A game-changing investment in the American people!
CNBC: Inflation was flat in October from the prior month, core CPI hits two-year low
Happy Diwali to all those celebrating the Festival of Lights in VA-08 and around the world!
I’m grateful for our veterans’ sacrifice and courage. On Veterans Day, we honor their service to our country and thank them for defending our freedom.
Forbes: House Speaker Mike Johnson Says He Refuses ‘To Put People Over Politics’

With government funding running out in just 8 days, MAGA Republicans and Speaker Mike Johnson have yet to present a viable solution to avoid a government shutdown. 

Americans deserve better. It’s time they work with Democrats to deliver a bipartisan solution and avoid a devastating shutdown.

Democrats passed the enhanced Child Tax Credit and cut child poverty nearly in half. Republicans fought against renewing it, and now millions more families are going hungry.
 
To make matters worse, Republicans are pushing to gut SNAP benefits that help millions of families get the food they need.

I support the Administration's push for a pause in military operations to get humanitarian assistance into Gaza and help civilians find safety. More must be done to help innocent Palestinian civilians as Hamas is held accountable for their awful acts and we work to free hostages.

One of the worst mass shootings in history happened last night in Maine. My heart goes out to the victims and their families, this is so awful. 

This doesn’t happen in other countries and it shouldn’t happen here. We need more leaders who are willing to do something about it.

Mike Johnson built his career on attacking marriage equality and LGBTQ Americans' rights. He was the main architect of efforts to overturn the 2020 election. He supports a national abortion ban with NO exceptions.

Every single House Republican just voted to make him Speaker.

It has now been three weeks since we had a Speaker of the House. The Republican civil war rages on, but we could end this chaos and dysfunction immediately if just a few of them were willing to work across the aisle.
If any of our Republican colleagues want to treat governing the country with the seriousness it deserves as opposed to a reality TV spectacle, Congressman Hakeem Jeffries has proposed a better way.
BIG NEWS: In August, the Biden administration announced 10 drugs for price negotiation. The companies have now agreed to come to the table to lower prescription prices for the American people.

Washington Post: Youngkin downplays shutdown threat, which hits just as Va. voting begins
www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/202...

I just received this letter from a U.S. Army Reserve soldier describing how a shutdown will impact her. 

It’s just awful. Nobody should be rooting for a shutdown, people will really get hurt if this happens.
CNN: The Republican Party infighting is driving America toward a government shutdown

Republicans fixating on the Senate dress code two weeks before a shutdown are wildly out of touch. 

Millions of American workers are about to go without pay because the House GOP can't do their jobs and this is where the focus is? 

America needs you to do better than this.
Axios: Dems urge McCarthy to face reality, work with them on spending bills

Happy Hispanic Heritage Month! Hispanic Americans continue to make powerful contributions to our nation and are integral to our society and our economy. Throughout this month, we celebrate this rich heritage.

Our society and national security depend on systems that heavily rely on space-based operations, but federal leadership isn't keeping pace with the ballooning number of satellites powering them. My bill with Donald Norcross and Representative Zoe Lofgren would help:

#OTD in 1994 President Clinton signed into law the federal Assault Weapons Ban, which was law for a decade until it expired in 2004. Congress should renew the Assault Weapons Ban – it would help prevent mass shootings, reduce gun violence, and save lives.
The Hill: Senate GOP says House lacks evidence for impeachment

Democrats passed the enhanced Child Tax Credit and cut child poverty nearly in half. Every Republican voted against it.

Republicans fought against renewing it, instead wanting to cut taxes for the wealthy and large corporations— and the child poverty rate just more than doubled.

Virginia is the only state in southeast that has not passed an abortion ban, but the Governor and Republicans in the General Assembly want to end that which would have ramifications well beyond the Commonwealth.

Intentionally shuttering the US government does lasting damage to our economy and inflicts harrowing uncertainty on millions of civil servants and their families.

Senator Tim Kaine and I have introduced the End Shutdowns Act to take this threat off the table for good.

Some good news breaking this morning: the August jobs report shows job growth again exceeding expectations, with a big rise in labor force participation rate.
abcnews.go.com/US/wireStory...

Last year Democrats passed a law to lower costs of key medicines by allowing Medicare to negotiate drug prices. This week the Biden Administration announced the first set of drugs subject to the law.

Millions of Americans will see prescription prices drop.
www.cnbc.com/amp/2023/08/...

Very sad to learn that Cpl. Spencer Collart of Arlington was one of three Marines killed in an Osprey crash in Australia. He was just 21. I can't imagine his family's pain, my heart is with them and the families of Cpt. Eleanor LeBeau and Maj. Tobin Lewis.
taskandpurpose.com/news/marine-...

Happy 107th birthday to the National Park Service! Thank you for giving us countless opportunities to connect with the outdoors, appreciate our wildlife, and marvel at our nation’s natural and cultural treasures.

Gun violence is the leading cause of death among children in the U.S.
 
This is a uniquely American crisis demanding Congressional action. Passing effective gun safety laws and the assault weapons ban is our moral imperative.
Reuters: US jobless claims fall as labor market remains tight
Axios: America's manufacturing boom could add 250,000 jobs in two years
Excited to join New Democrat Coalition’s new AI working group as Vice Chair as we work on policies that position the U.S. as a world leader in AI innovation and safety.

“Rep. Don Beyer praised the Inflation Reduction Act for reversing "years of chronic underinvestment in the IRS" and stressed how important he thinks it is for the government to provide a direct-file option for taxpayers."

One year ago, President Biden signed the Inflation Reduction Act into law. Since its enactment, the law has grown our economy with 170,606 new middle-class jobs and $278 billion in new private-sector investments – and we’re just getting started!

Veterans exposed to toxic substances during their service may be eligible for extra benefits under the PACT Act. There is no deadline or fee to a claim file, but those who file by August 9 may be eligible for backdate benefits. Apply today!

Millions of Americans are suffering from the effects of Long Covid and too few have received the care they deserve. We’ve lagged on this too long, but I’m glad to see NIH take an important step forward by launching clinical trials that will lead to improved treatments.
Springfield, Virginia is undoubtedly the best location for a new FBI headquarters.
“Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Wednesday said the central bank’s staff are no longer forecasting a recession.”

When the Americans with Disabilities Act was signed 33 years ago, it became a catalyst for the inclusion of and equity for millions of Americans living with disabilities.
 
Today, the fight to secure equal rights and opportunities continues – but we celebrate how far we have come.
AP News: U.S. consumer confidence jumps to a two-year high as inflation eases

25 years ago today USCP officers Jacob Chestnut and Detective John Gibson were shot and killed by a gunman as they protected the public in the Capitol. They lay in honor in the Capitol Rotunda and are buried in Arlington National Cemetery. We remember their service and sacrifice.

It’s been 14 years since the last federal minimum wage increase to $7.25. This is not a fair living wage in 2023.
 
We should raise the minimum wage for workers, strengthen the middle class and boost the American economy.
“Nearly 60% of economists said their main reason for optimism about the economic outlook is their expectation that inflation will continue to slow.”
The Equal Rights Amendment has passed both chambers of Congress and has been ratified by 38 states. The ERA belongs in our Constitution.
The Washington Post: House GOP seeks billions in cuts to rail, water infrastructure spending
Extreme MAGA Republicans are fighting for special tax breaks for the wealthy and well-connected while cutting investments that benefit America’s working families.

"In addition to enjoying solid wage growth, Americans are taking comfort in slower price increases for everyday items—such as gasoline and groceries—that have the biggest influence on their perception of inflation."
Good news for more than 804,000 borrowers – the Biden administration is providing $39 billion in debt relief! Eligible borrowers will receive notifications in the coming days.

Forbes: Federal Policies Are Fueling An American Clean Energy Jobs And Investment Boom
https://www.forbes.com/sites/energyinnovation/2023/07/10/federal-policies-are-fueling-an-american-clean-energy-jobs-and-investment-boom/

Two years ago, American working families began receiving their Child Tax Credit deposits in their bank accounts. This benefit resulted in the largest poverty reduction in US history. A BIG deal. 

We should reinstate the Child Tax Credit. There is no good argument against it.
House Republicans filled a normally bipartisan bill to authorize US military operations with extreme poison pills including anti-abortion riders and open bigotry.

HuffPost: Inflation Report Raises A Startling Possibility: Washington Got COVID Right
https://www.huffpost.com/entry/inflation-report-washington-dc-joe-biden-covid_n_64aee07fe4b0e87d6558744f
House Republicans just overwhelmingly voted for an amendment to the National Defense Reauthorization Act to ban funding for access to critical health care for American servicewomen, which passed:
The Inflation Reduction Act is lowering energy costs for Americans. Find out how you can save money through tax credits and rebates at cleanenergy.gov!
This is great news from the FDA! Expanding access to contraception is a big win for reproductive health care.
AP News: From airfares to used cars to groceries, slowing US inflation eases pressure on households

I’m really glad to see the Biden Administration taking significant steps to lower child care costs for American families and boosting support for the providers who do this important work.
 
Affordable child care is a great thing – not only for American families, but for the American economy!

12 months in a row of falling inflation.

Inflation cut by two thirds in the past year.

The longest run of sub-4% unemployment in 50 years.

The strongest job creation on record.

Cutting costs for American families and growing the middle class.

Bidenomics in action.

“Today, the U.S. has had the highest economic growth rate, leading the world economies since the pandemic. The highest in the world,” Biden said during a speech Wednesday in Chicago. “And folks, that’s no accident. That’s Bidenomics in action.”

Veterans who apply by August 9 and qualify under the PACT Act may be eligible to receive benefits backdated to August 10, 2022.
https://www.13newsnow.com/article/news/national/military-news/va-urges-veterans-apply-pact-act-benefits/291-c8e29884-ec1c-4539-9ef8-78901ced7ce1

When Democrats passed the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act to invest in transit, roads & bridges, rural broadband, and clean water only 13 Republicans voted in favor. Now they're taking credit for projects they voted against.
Frankly, ranked choice voting is pretty great. Congress should pass the Fair Representation Act to make sure every voter's voice is heard.

Thanks to legislation passed by House Democrats last year, monthly insulin costs are now capped at $35 per month for Americans on Medicare.

Democrats lowered prices for life-saving medicine. Every Republican voted no.

Do I support Supreme Court reform? 

Yes. I co-wrote the Supreme Court Term Limits and Regular Appointments Act and I am a cosponsor of the Judicial Ethics and Anti-Corruption Act and the Judiciary Act.
Under President Biden the US economy has created 13.2 million jobs and at 3.6%, unemployment remains near historic lows. America’s economy remains strong and resilient – that’s Bidenomics!
“The boom in US manufacturing construction is a real one: driven by the administration’s policy focus and led by technology manufacturing.”
The American consumer’s confidence jumped in June to its highest level in 18 months as a strong labor market continues to buoy the U.S. economy.”

A historic session for the Supreme Court in its awfulness. They are simply out of touch with the lived experience of the American people while refusing to ensure they or the plaintiffs they welcome have a foot in reality. 

The need for reform is obvious and clear.

From Sotomayor's dissent: "In so holding, the Court cements a superficial rule of colorblindness as a constitutional principle in an endemically segregated society where race has always mattered and continues to matter."
Republicans don’t care about debt or deficits. They care more about shielding the ultra-wealthy from paying their fair share of taxes.
I extend my warmest wishes to all celebrating Eid al-Adha, marking the end of the pilgrimage of Hajj. May your celebration be filled with joy and love. Eid Mubarak!
In a big win for democracy and our system of checks and balances, the Supreme Court has rejected the so-called “independent state legislature” theory.

Happy Equality Day! Today, we celebrate the anniversary of three landmark Supreme Court decisions protecting LGBTQ+ rights: Lawrence v Texas (2003), Windsor v US (2013), and Obergefell v Hodges (2015). 

In recent years, we’ve made incredible progress affirming LGBTQ+ rights and we won’t go back.

“In one government funding bill after another, Republicans are incorporating unrelated policy provisions, known as riders, to restrict women’s reproductive rights. Democrats say the proposals will never become law.”

A year ago, the Supreme Court's Dobbs v. Jackson ruling stripped millions of essential reproductive health care. While Republicans relentlessly pursue nationwide abortion restrictions, I proudly stand as a co-sponsor of the Women's Health Protection Act to protect abortion access across the country.
Washington Post: Most Americans think overturning Roe was bad for the country

Since it was enacted 51 years ago, Title IX has broken barriers and opened doors for girls and women in schools and universities across America. It’s been a game-changer in ensuring that everyone, regardless of gender, has a chance to succeed!
The Child Tax Credit resulted in the largest poverty reduction in US history. We should reinstate it.

“Republicans have unveiled a set of new tax proposals that would cost the government billions of dollars — by handing tens of billions of dollars of tax cuts to the richest 1 percent of Americans, as a new report reveals.”

We shouldn't condone the enslavement of human beings or armed rebellion against the United States government. That’s why I’ve introduced bicameral legislation with Senator Kaine to redesignate the Arlington House, Robert E. Lee Memorial to its original name: Arlington House. Read more:
After years of backlogs and underfunding, the Inflation Reduction Act has been a big step forward in modernizing a vital agency.

Amidst a biodiversity crisis, the Trump administration severely weakened one of the most important laws we have to protect endangered flora and fauna. Really glad to see the Biden administration take necessary action to save more species from extinction.

Republicans' stupid resolution censuring Congressman Adam Schiff is itself riddled with falsehoods. 

So many of them told the lie that the 2020 election was stolen.

Donald Trump threatened anyone who voted against this, that's why Republicans are wasting our time with this drivel.

The largest group of House Republicans just released a budget that calls for massive tax cuts for the super-rich and raising the Social Security retirement age, a benefit cut for millions of Americans.
MAGA Republicans are fighting to give more tax breaks to the ultra-wealthy at the expense of relief for working families.

I’m glad to see Fairfax is working to break down the stigma surrounding mental health for our first responders, who are too often put in the middle of events that inflict severe emotional trauma. This is a significant step forward in providing them with the resources they need for their well-being.

I just offered an amendment to the Republican tax scam bill to stop the bulk of tax credits meant to encourage investment in small businesses from flowing to millionaires and billionaires.

Every single Republican voted against it. Republicans keep fighting for the super-rich.

Republicans don’t care about debt or deficits, they only care about shielding billionaires from paying their fair share.

https://www.wsj.com/articles/with-debt-ceiling-deal-done-house-gop-looks-to-cut-taxes-2fcf4fa6

7 years ago, the Orlando community and our nation were devastated by a mass shooting that claimed the lives of 49 people and wounded over 50 more. As we remember the victims of thisattack, we stand against hate and bigotry.

Text of the indictment in the case of United States of America v. Donald J. Trump:

https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.flsd.648653/gov.uscourts.flsd.648653.3.0.pdf

Earth’s oceans generate 50 percent of the oxygen we need and absorb more than 90 percent of the heat trapped by greenhouse gas emissions – they’re our biggest ally in the fight against climate change. This World Ocean Day, we’re reminded of our urgent responsibility to protect and conserve them.
One thing you can count on House Republicans to fight for: gutting IRS funding to protect wealthy tax cheats.

Dark plumes of smoke from wildfires in Quebec are destined to reach the East Coast and the District this week. 

Here’s what you need to know about the health effects of wildfire smoke and how to protect yourself on days with poor air quality. https://wapo.st/45SUdlV

58 years ago, the Griswold v. Connecticut ruling established the right to privacy protects Americans’ use of birth control.
 
While we have made much progress since, MAGA Republicans continue to threaten reproductive freedoms including abortion and contraception access.

What was supposed to be a celebration at a high school graduation is now a traumatic tragedy. This has become the norm and many of my colleagues in Congress still refuse to do anything about it. We must do more. American communities are crying out for gun violence reform.
Under President Biden, we’ve added a record 13 million jobs to the US economy. That’s more jobs than under any other president in a full four-year term.

Canary Media: US wind manufacturing makes a comeback thanks to Inflation Reduction Act

https://www.canarymedia.com/articles/clean-energy-manufacturing/us-wind-manufacturing-makes-a-comeback-thanks-to-inflation-reduction-act

The reality of changing DCA’s slot and perimeter rules: “This would make a mess of DCA — worsening delays, noise, congestion and overcrowding — while destabilizing the regional air network.”
https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2023/06/02/dca-reagan-perimeter-rule-congress/

May this #WorldEnvironmentDay serve as a reminder of our responsibility to do our part to stop the harmful consequences of climate change and build a sustainable, healthy environment for future generations.

Every year, we lose thousands of lives to gun violence in the United States. It is not rational to live with this reality and continue to do absolutely nothing. We must continue to push for solutions to gun violence. American lives depend on it.

The list of American Presidents who ever presided over 13 million jobs created in one term: Joe Biden. 

That's it. That's the list.

Happy Pride Month! As we celebrate the contributions and resilience of the LGBTQ+ community, we’re reminded now more than ever of our responsibility to speak out against bigotry and fight for equality.

Thrilled to join Neighborhood Health, HHS Secretary Becerra, and AANHPI leaders for a productive roundtable discussion this morning on how we can reduce barriers and increase opportunities to access healthcare for the AANHPI community.

“Republican National Committee Chair Ronna McDaniel suggested Wednesday that while a default would likely be bad for the country, it would be good for her party politically.”

https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2023/05/republicans-debt-ceiling-negotiations

Put simply, the Supreme Court’s decision to strip Clean Water Act protections from America’s wetlands and waterways protects polluters at the expense of Americans' clean water.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2023/05/25/supreme-court-clean-water-act/

MAGA Republicans are holding our economy hostage and threatening a catastrophic default that would hurt millions of American families.
https://www.cnn.com/2023/05/12/business/debt-ceiling-default-economy/index.html

One year ago a mass shooting at Robb Elementary School left 21 killed and many more permanently scarred in Uvalde, Texas. That community's pain, sorrow, and anger is palpable today. 

https://www.npr.org/2023/05/24/1177729989/a-year-after-uvaldes-school-massacre-healing-remains-elusive

I recently introduced the Half-Earth initiative – one of the final proposals from my friend, Dr. E.O. Wilson, the legendary biologist who coined the term "biodiversity."

Reminder: House Republicans raised the debt ceiling without poison pills THREE TIMES under President Trump. They can choose to raise it again but instead are threatening to cause a recession on purpose to extract ransom demands.
House Republicans are holding the economy hostage in an attempt to force cuts to critical assistance for millions of Americans while protecting tax cuts for the wealthy.
The Republican caucus is now officially the SAVE SANTOS CAUCUS. They will do whatever it takes to protect him.
